fields.summary: euca-delete-volume with invalid format for volume ID does not return an error

comments.body: Starting investigation.  Will provide debugging output from Eucalyptus and AWS.

Confirmed.  Debugging information provided below:

Client.InvalidParameterValue: Value (vol-8888888) for parameter volume is invalid. Expected: 'vol-...'.
com.amazon.aes.webservices.client.Jec2SoapFaultException: SOAP Fault[code=Client.InvalidParameterValue, str='Value (vol-8888888) for parameter volume is invalid. Expected: 'vol-...'.']
	at com.amazon.aes.webservices.client.Jec2Impl.UnwrapException(Jec2Impl.java:334)
	at com.amazon.aes.webservices.client.Jec2Impl.deleteVolume(Jec2Impl.java:2724)
	at com.amazon.aes.webservices.client.cmd.DeleteVolume.invokeOnline(DeleteVolume.java:49)

	at com.amazon.aes.webservices.client.cmd.DeleteVolume.main(DeleteVolume.java:59)

Fix verified.

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.0.0
Release     : 0.0.838.20140407gitab90b6ae.el6

Volume ID format is checked
{code}
[root@c-35 ~]# euca-delete-volume vol-8888888*
euca-delete-volume: error (InvalidParameterValue): Value (vol-8888888*) for parameter volume is invalid. Expected: 'vol-...'.
[root@c-35 ~]# euca-delete-volume vol-888888
euca-delete-volume: error (InvalidParameterValue): Value (vol-888888) for parameter volume is invalid. Expected: 'vol-...'.
[root@c-35 ~]# euca-delete-volume ol-888888
euca-delete-volume: error (InvalidParameterValue): Value (ol-888888) for parameter volume is invalid. Expected: 'vol-...'.
{code}
